org.fluidity.composition

Annotation Type Component


  • @Documented
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Qualifier(value=NONE)
public @interface Component
    Specifies the component interface(s) that a class implements, which should resolve to the annotated class at run time by a dependency injection container.

    This annotation is also a marker for the org.fluidity.maven:composition-maven-plugin Maven plugin to make configuration-free dependency injection possible.

    For any class marked with this annotation and without having automatic processing disabled, i.e., without @Component(automatic = false), the composition-maven-plugin Maven plugin will generate at build time the necessary metadata that the dependency injection container will need to pick up and process the annotated class at run time.

    Usage

     @Component
 public final class MyComponent {

   MyComponent(final MyDependency dependency) {
     …
   }

   …
 }
 
     @Component
 final class MyDependencyImpl implements MyDependency {
   …
 }

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Fields and Description
      static String SCOPE
      The service provider type for scoped components.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      Class<?>[] api
      Specifies the interfaces or classes that should resolve to the annotated class at run time.
      boolean automatic
      When not specified or set to true, this parameter specifies that the annotated class can be automatically added to a global container.
      boolean primary
      Tells whether the annotated class is a primary implementation of its component interface(s) or just a fallback or default implementation.
      Class<?> scope
      Specifies that this component is scoped to a component with the given component interface, as opposed to being globally accessible.
      boolean stateful
      Tells whether the annotated component should be singleton or a new instance must be created for every query or reference.

    • Field Detail

      • SCOPE

        public static final String SCOPE
        The service provider type for scoped components. Used internally.

    • Element Detail

      • api

        public abstract Class<?>[] api
        Specifies the interfaces or classes that should resolve to the annotated class at run time.

        In case of ComponentFactory, the value applies to the component the factory creates, not the factory itself.

        When omitted, the property defaults to the list of interfaces determined by the algorithm documented at Components.

        Returns:
        an array of class objects.
        Default:
        {}

      • automatic

        public abstract boolean automatic
        When not specified or set to true, this parameter specifies that the annotated class can be automatically added to a global container.

        Setting this property to false allows the class to be added to a container programmatically, or to merely to define a list of interfaces for another class to pick up, such as a ComponentFactory implementation.

        Programmatic handling of the component entails either:

        • explicitly binding the class to some local container,
        • explicitly instantiating the component,
        • having the annotation's scope parameter set to a component interface to which the foregoing applies,
        • having another component's api parameter refer to the annotated class, or
        • provision of a suitable PackageBindings object that adds the component to a global container.
        Returns:
        true if this component should be automatically processed.
        See Also:
        EmptyPackageBindings
        Default:
        true

      • primary

        public abstract boolean primary
        Tells whether the annotated class is a primary implementation of its component interface(s) or just a fallback or default implementation. As a fallback it will be used when no other class has been marked for the same component interface as a primary. This parameter defaults to true, which means the annotated component is the primary implementation of its component interfaces.
        Returns:
        true if this component should be bound as a primary implementation of its component interfaces.
        Default:
        true

      • stateful

        public abstract boolean stateful
        Tells whether the annotated component should be singleton or a new instance must be created for every query or reference. This parameter defaults to false, which means that the annotated component is a singleton (or semi-singleton in case of context dependent components).
        Returns:
        true if a new instance should be created for every query or dependency reference.
        Default:
        false

      • scope

        public abstract Class<?> scope
        Specifies that this component is scoped to a component with the given component interface, as opposed to being globally accessible. Setting this parameter implies automatic = false.

        Unless it itself implements the component interface it is scoped to, the annotated component is not supposed to be bound in any way by the developer; it is automatically bound when the given component interface is either bound in a local container or directly instantiated.

        When any of the foregoing occurs, Fluid Tools automatically binds every component that has this parameter set to the given component interface. This makes it possible to have an isolated sub-graph of dependency injected components for every binding / instance of the given component interface.

        Returns:
        a component interface class.
        Default:
        java.lang.Object.class
